gurmukhi: ਰਿਖੰ ਭੇਸ ਕੀਯੰ ॥ ਤਿਸੈ ਰਾਜ ਦੀਯੰ ॥੫॥
translation: He put on the garb of a sage (rishi) and gave his kingdom to the reciter (Amrit Rai)5.

gurmukhi: ਰਹੇ ਹੋਰ ਲੋਗੰ ॥ ਤਜੇ ਸਰਬ ਸੋਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Rahe Hor Logadg|| Taje Sarab Sogadg||
translation: The people tried to the king to do so, but, he had abandoned all sorrows.

gurmukhi: ਧਨੰ ਧਾਮ ਤਿਅਾਗੇ ॥ ਪ੍ਰਭੰ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਪਾਗੇ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Dhanan Dhaam Tiaage|| Prabhan Prem Paage||6||
translation: And leaving his wealth and property, absorbed himself in divine love.6.

gurmukhi: ਬੇਦੀ ਭੲੇ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨ ਰਾਜ ਕਹ ਪਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥ ਦੇਤ ਭਯੋ ਬਰਦਾਨ ਹੀਅੈ ਹੁਲਸਾੲਿ ਕੈ ॥
transliteration: Bedoo Bhae Prasann Raaj Kah Paae Kai|| Det Bhayo Bardaan Hooai Hulsaae Kai||
translation: Having been bestowed the kingdom, the Bedis were very much pleased. With happy heart, he predicted this boon:

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਨਾਨਕ ਕਲਿ ਮੈ ਹਮ ਅਾਨ ਕਹਾੲਿਹੈਂ ॥ ਹੋ ਜਗਤ ਪੂਜ ਕਰਿ ਤੋਹਿ ਪਰਮ ਪਦ ਪਾੲਿਹੈਂ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Jab Naanak Kal(i) Mai Ham Aan Kahaae-hain|| Ho Jagad Pooj Kar(i) Toh(i) Param Pad Paae-hain||7||
translation: “When in the Iron age, I shall be called Nanak, you will attain the Supreme State and be worshipped by the world.”7.

gurmukhi: ਲਵੀ ਰਾਜ ਦੇ ਬਨ ਗੲੇ ਬੇਦੀਅਨ ਕੀਨੋ ਰਾਜ ॥
transliteration: Lavoo Raaj De Ban Gad Bedooan Koono Raaj||
translation: The descendants of Lava, after handing over the kingdom, went to the forest, and the Bedis (descendants of Kusha) began to rule.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤਿ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਤਿਨਿ ਭੋਗੀਯੰ ਭੂਅ ਕਾ ਸਕਲ ਸਮਾਜ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Tin(i) Bhogooyan Bhooa Kaa Sakal Samaaj||8||
translation: They enjoyed all comforts of the earth in various ways.8.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਤੀਅ ਬੇਦ ਸੁਨਬੋ ਤੁਮ ਕੀਅਾ ॥ ਚਤੁਰ ਬੇਦ ਸੁਨਿ ਭੂਅ ਕੋ ਦੀਅਾ ॥
transliteration: Tritooa Bed Sounbo Toum Kooaa|| Chatur Bed Soun(i) Bhooa Ko Dooaa||
translation: “O Sodhi king! You have listened to the recitation of three Vedas, and while listening to the fourth, you gave away your kingdom.

gurmukhi: ਤੀਨ ਜਨਮ ਹਮਹੂੰ ਜਬ ਧਰਿਹੈਂ ॥ ਚੳੁਥੇ ਜਨਮ ਗੁਰੂ ਤੁਹਿ ਕਰਿਹੈਂ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Tin Janam Ham-hoon Jab Dharihain|| Chaouthe Janam Guroo Tuh(i) Karihain||9||
translation: “When I shall have taken three births, you will be made the Guru in he fourth birth.”9.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤ ਰਾਜਾ ਕਾਨਨਹਿ ਸਿਧਾਯੋ ॥ ੲਿਤ ੲਿਨ ਰਾਜ ਕਰਤ ਸੁਖ ਪਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Out Raajaa Kaananah(i) Sidhaayo|| It In Raaj Karat Souch Paayo||
translation: That (Sodhi) king left for the forest, and this (Bedi) king absorbed himself in royal pleasures.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਲਗੇ ਕਰਿ ਕਥਾ ਸੁਨਾੳੂਂ ॥ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਬਢਨ ਤੇ ਅਧਿਕ ਡਰਾੳੂਂ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Kahaa Lage Kar(i) Kathaa Sounaaoon|| Granth Badhan Te Adhik Daraaoon||10||
translation: To what extent, I should narrate the story? It is feared that this book will become voluminous.10.
